snippet: Katie Commodore, an artist from Flatbush, Brooklyn, has used her naturally facetious attitude to deal with a multiple sclerosis diagnosis she received in 2008.
abstract: Community Health Advocates, program run by Community Service Society of New York, one of seven organizations supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, helps Katie Commodore pay for personal trainer to help with her multiple sclerosis.
lead_paragraph: Katie Commodore, an artist from Flatbush, Brooklyn, has used her naturally facetious attitude to deal with a multiple sclerosis diagnosis she received in 2008.

headline.print_headline: An Artist Uses Humor As a Salve For an Illness
headline.main: An Artist Uses Humor as a Salve for an Illness
